sentences.sContent: The meat of the herbivore is, in comparison, far more edible , smellwise.
sentences.sContent_eng: The meat of the herbivore is, in comparison, far more edible , smellwise.
sentences.sCn: 相对地，食草动物的肉闻起来要好些，更易食用。

sentences.sContent: I only eat vegetables (scientists call me a herbivore) -- almost always leaves from the tops of trees.
sentences.sContent_eng: I only eat vegetables (scientists call me a herbivore) -- almost always leaves from the tops of trees.
sentences.sCn: 我只吃蔬菜(科学家称我为草食动物)—几乎常常是树梢的叶子。

sentences.sContent: You probably would call me a vegetarian. But scientists call me a herbivore because I only eat leaves, grass and other plants.
sentences.sContent_eng: You probably would call me a vegetarian. But scientists call me a herbivore because I only eat leaves, grass and other plants.
sentences.sCn: 可能你会说我是素食者，但科学家称我为草食动物，因为我只吃叶子、草和其它植物。

remMethod.val: herb(i)(草) + vor(吃) + e → 食草动物

trans.tranOther: an animal that only eats plants
